title: Session 1: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and Neural Networks
description: This session introduces the fundamentals of AI, including definitions, real-world applications, supervised vs. unsupervised learning, mathematical foundations, and a first look at basic neural network architectures.
objectives: Define the scope of Artificial Intelligence and its real-world applications
Distinguish between supervised and unsupervised learning
Understand basic neural network architecture
Recall essential math concepts for AI (linear algebra, basic calculus)
Explain fundamental programming principles for AI (data types, control structures)

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a type of machine learning?
Explain the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning in your own words.
A neural network typically consists of an input layer, one or more hidden layers, and an ________ layer.
True or False: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) is already widely available and in use today.
Which mathematical operation is most often used to combine inputs and weights in a fully connected layer?
You have a dataset of labeled images for a digit-classification task (0–9). Outline how you would build a simple neural network to classify these images, from data preprocessing to final evaluation.
Name two ways in which strong programming fundamentals (e.g., control structures, functions, modules) support AI development.

resources.title: But what is a neural network?
Introduction to Machine Learning for Beginners
Mathematics for Machine Learning: Linear Algebra

title: Session 2: Convolutional Neural Networks and Computer Vision
description: This session dives into CNN architectures, exploring how convolutional layers, pooling, transfer learning, feature extraction, and fundamental computer vision techniques power modern image-based tasks.
objectives: Explain the role of convolutional layers in feature extraction
Understand pooling, activation functions, and batch normalization
Describe how transfer learning can accelerate vision model training
Identify common computer vision tasks (image classification, segmentation, detection)
Understand basic data augmentation techniques for images

questions.questionText: Which layer in a CNN is primarily responsible for reducing spatial dimensions?
In your own words, explain why feature extraction is critical in computer vision.
True or False: Transfer learning involves training a model from scratch on a large dataset before fine-tuning on a smaller, specialized dataset.
________ functions introduce non-linearity into CNNs, allowing them to learn complex patterns.
Which of the following is NOT a common data augmentation technique for images?
You want to classify medical images (X-rays). Outline a procedure to implement transfer learning using a pre-trained CNN. Highlight the steps for data preparation, model selection, and validation.
Explain how pooling layers help prevent overfitting in CNNs.

title: Session 3: Object Detection with YOLOv8
description: Learn how YOLOv8 detects and labels objects in real time, covering anchor-free detection, multi-scale feature fusion, evaluation metrics, and custom dataset training for high-accuracy results.
objectives: Understand the fundamentals of object detection
Explain YOLOv8's anchor-free architecture
Train and fine-tune YOLOv8 on a custom dataset
Discuss evaluation metrics such as mAP and IoU
Implement real-time object detection in a practical setting

questions.questionText: Which metric is commonly used to evaluate object detection performance?
True or False: YOLOv8 relies on anchor boxes to detect and classify objects.
Describe a real-world application where object detection could significantly improve efficiency or safety.
YOLO stands for 'You Only Look ________'.
Which of the following best describes IoU (Intersection over Union)?
options: A method for combining bounding boxes
A ratio comparing the overlap of predicted and ground-truth boxes
A technique to rotate bounding boxes
A way to measure activation in convolutional layers

questions.questionText: What are some key advantages of anchor-free detection compared to anchor-based methods?

You need to detect defects on a manufacturing line in real time using YOLOv8. Outline how you would integrate the model into a production system, including data flow, model updates, and performance monitoring.

title: Session 4: Audio Classification and Processing
description: Discover how to handle and preprocess audio data, extract features (Fourier transforms, Mel Spectrograms), and build classification models capable of recognizing environmental sounds or speech commands.
objectives: Explain how audio signals are digitized and represented
Perform feature extraction using transforms (Fourier, Mel Spectrogram)
Build and evaluate deep learning models for audio classification
Discuss real-time audio classification challenges
Identify common pitfalls in handling imbalanced audio datasets

questions.questionText: Which library is commonly used in Python for audio processing?
Explain the difference between time-domain and frequency-domain representations in audio.
True or False: A Mel Spectrogram focuses on uniformly spaced frequencies, just like a standard spectrogram.
________ is a popular Python library that simplifies audio feature extraction and analysis, used frequently in music information retrieval.
Which method can help address imbalanced audio datasets?
options: Collecting more data for underrepresented classes
Lowering the sampling rate for the minority class
Using identical audio clips for all classes

questions.questionText: Name two real-life applications of audio classification and how they benefit society or businesses.

You are building a voice command system for a smart home device. Outline how you would handle data collection, feature engineering, model training, and real-time inference to ensure accurate command recognition.

title: Session 5: Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
description: Explore the architecture and capabilities of advanced LLMs, learn how to integrate external knowledge bases via Retrieval-Augmented Generation, and discuss ethical considerations of deploying large-scale language models.
objectives: Understand transformer-based language model architecture
Explain the concept of Retrieval-Augmented Generation
Build a simple RAG pipeline for question answering
Explore ethical considerations (bias, hallucinations) in LLMs
Experiment with fine-tuning techniques for domain-specific tasks

questions.questionText: Which component is essential for Retrieval-Augmented Generation?
Describe a real-world scenario where an LLM combined with a retrieval mechanism would be invaluable.
True or False: Prompt engineering is unnecessary if you have a sufficiently large pre-trained language model.
A common vector database used in RAG pipelines is ________.
Which of the following is an example of an ethical concern in LLMs?

You are building a chatbot that provides medical advice. How would you integrate retrieval-augmented generation to ensure the bot references accurate medical documents, and how would you mitigate ethical risks like misinformation?
Explain how fine-tuning a pre-trained LLM differs from training an LLM from scratch.

resources.title: Ethics in AI and Language Models

title: Session 6: Project Mentorship and Final Presentations
description: Consolidate everything learned so far into a final capstone project. This session includes personalized mentorship, showcasing solutions, and peer feedback to refine ideas for real-world impact. We also touch on advanced AI techniques (like ensemble methods, XAI) and best practices for presenting technical work.
objectives: Apply AI techniques to solve a real-world problem
Refine project scope and deliverables through mentorship
Present and demonstrate AI solutions to peers and stakeholders
Explore advanced AI concepts like ensemble methods and explainable AI
Practice effective communication and Q&A handling during presentations

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a best practice for AI project presentations?
options: Only discuss the final results with no context
Provide a clear problem statement and solution approach
Use as many technical acronyms as possible
Skip audience Q&A to save time

questions.questionText: Reflect on a major challenge you faced during your capstone project and how you overcame it.
True or False: Providing visual aids such as charts or demos can help non-technical stakeholders grasp complex AI concepts.
A well-structured ________ ensures that your AI project’s methodology is transparent and reproducible.
When planning your next steps after the BootCamp, which option is NOT recommended?
options: Deleting your project repositories to start fresh

questions.questionText: You are presenting a deep learning model that uses ensemble methods and XAI (Explainable AI) techniques. Outline how you would demonstrate the model’s performance and explainability to a non-technical panel.
Name one advantage and one drawback of using ensemble methods in your final capstone project.
